title: Sunday shows — Officials rush to Trump's defense on Syria, sanctions
text:
Members of President Trump Donald John TrumpGiuliani says he is unaware of reported federal investigation Louisiana's Democratic governor forced into runoff Lawmakers focus their ire on NBA, not China MORE's Cabinet including Defense Secretary Mark Esper Mark EsperSunday Show Preview: Trump's allies and administration defend decision on Syria Five ways Trump's Syria decision spells trouble Commander of Syrian Kurds to US: 'You are leaving us to be slaughtered' MORE and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin Steven Terner MnuchinPutin calls for foreign militaries to leave Syria Overnight Defense: Pentagon insists US hasn't abandoned Kurds | Trump expands sanctions authority against Turkey | Ex-Ukraine ambassador says Trump pushed for her ouster On The Money: Trump announces limited trade deal with China | Appeals court rules against Trump over financial records | Trump expands authority to sanction Turkey MORE appeared on the Sunday morning political talk shows to defend the president's decision to remove U.S. troops from northern Syria ahead of a Turkish military operation and the delay of sanctions against Ankara.

Top Democrats also weighed in on the latest developments in the House's impeachment inquiry into Trump.

Read The Hill's complete coverage below.

Esper: Turkey 'appears to be' committing war crimes in northern Syria By ZACK BUDRYK Defense Secretary Mark Esper said Sunday that Turkey “appears to be” committing war crimes in its incursion into northern Syria. Read the full story here

Mnuchin defends delay in sanctions against Turkey: 'This is a complicated, developing situation' By KYLE BALLUCK Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Sunday defended a delay in imposing sanctions on Turkey, saying the Trump administration is ready to move forward “at a moment’s notice” over Ankara's military action in northern Syria.
